trans-unit.source: Step 4: Create and Deploy the XML Bridge
trans-unit.target: Step 4: Create and Deploy the XML Bridge

trans-unit.source: In this topic, you create an <token>one-way</token> that acts as a connector between the EDI Receive <token>bridge</token> and the relay endpoint for the ORDERS05 IDOC in SAP.
trans-unit.target: In this topic, you create an <token>one-way</token> that acts as a connector between the EDI Receive <token>bridge</token> and the relay endpoint for the ORDERS05 IDOC in SAP.

trans-unit.source: After configuring the <token>bridge</token>, you connect it to the SAP relay endpoint, and then deploy the solution.
trans-unit.target: After configuring the <token>bridge</token>, you connect it to the SAP relay endpoint, and then deploy the solution.

trans-unit.source: To configure the XML Bridge
trans-unit.target: To configure the XML Bridge

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>SAPIntegration</embeddedLabel> project, from the Solution Explorer, double-click the <embeddedLabel>MessageFlowItinerary.bcs</embeddedLabel> file to open the <token>bridge</token> design area.
trans-unit.target: In the <embeddedLabel>SAPIntegration</embeddedLabel> project, from the Solution Explorer, double-click the <embeddedLabel>MessageFlowItinerary.bcs</embeddedLabel> file to open the <token>bridge</token> design area.

trans-unit.source: Right-click anywhere on the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design area, select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>, and update the <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service URL</embeddedLabel> property to include your <token>af_integration</token> name.
trans-unit.target: Right-click anywhere on the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design area, select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>, and update the <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service URL</embeddedLabel> property to include your <token>af_integration</token> name.

trans-unit.source: This is the name that you provided in <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=211879</linkUri></externalLink> while provisioning the <token>af_integration</token>.
trans-unit.target: This is the name that you provided in <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=211879</linkUri></externalLink> while provisioning the <token>af_integration</token>.

trans-unit.source: From the <embeddedLabel>Toolbox</embeddedLabel>, drag and drop the <embeddedLabel><token>one-way</token></embeddedLabel> component to the bridge design area.
trans-unit.target: From the <embeddedLabel>Toolbox</embeddedLabel>, drag and drop the <embeddedLabel><token>one-way</token></embeddedLabel> component to the bridge design area.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the <embeddedLabel><token>one-way</token></embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>, and change the value for <embeddedLabel>Entity Name</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>Relative Address</embeddedLabel> properties to <userInput>B2BConnector</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the <embeddedLabel><token>one-way</token></embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>, and change the value for <embeddedLabel>Entity Name</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>Relative Address</embeddedLabel> properties to <userInput>B2BConnector</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: As a result, the complete endpoint URL where the bridge is deployed, which is shown in the <embeddedLabel>Runtime Address</embeddedLabel> property, will resemble <codeInline>https://<legacyItalic>%%amp;lt;mybiztalkservicename%%amp;gt;</legacyItalic>.biztalk.windows.net/default/B2BConnector</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: As a result, the complete endpoint URL where the bridge is deployed, which is shown in the <embeddedLabel>Runtime Address</embeddedLabel> property, will resemble <codeInline>https://<legacyItalic>%%amp;lt;mybiztalkservicename%%amp;gt;</legacyItalic>.biztalk.windows.net/default/B2BConnector</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: This is where the EDI Receive <token>bridge</token> sends the ORDERS05 PO message.
trans-unit.target: This is where the EDI Receive <token>bridge</token> sends the ORDERS05 PO message.

trans-unit.source: Double-click the <token>one-way</token> to open the <token>msgflow</token> design area.
trans-unit.target: Double-click the <token>one-way</token> to open the <token>msgflow</token> design area.

trans-unit.source: Because this <token>bridge</token> only routes the message from the EDI Receive <token>bridge</token> to the relay endpoint, there’s not much configuration required for each stage in the <token>bridge</token> stage other than specifying the message types of the message that this <token>bridge</token> routes.
trans-unit.target: Because this <token>bridge</token> only routes the message from the EDI Receive <token>bridge</token> to the relay endpoint, there’s not much configuration required for each stage in the <token>bridge</token> stage other than specifying the message types of the message that this <token>bridge</token> routes.

trans-unit.source: To specify the message type, on the <token>one-way</token> design surface, within the <embeddedLabel>Message Types</embeddedLabel> box, select the add icon [ <mediaLinkInline><image xlink:href="fce8ff96-426e-468b-8afd-25eb4c847028" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"></image></mediaLinkInline> ] to open the <embeddedLabel>Message Type Picker</embeddedLabel> dialog box.
trans-unit.target: To specify the message type, on the <token>one-way</token> design surface, within the <embeddedLabel>Message Types</embeddedLabel> box, select the add icon [ <mediaLinkInline><image xlink:href="fce8ff96-426e-468b-8afd-25eb4c847028" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"></image></mediaLinkInline> ] to open the <embeddedLabel>Message Type Picker</embeddedLabel> dialog box.

trans-unit.source: In <embeddedLabel>Message Type Picker</embeddedLabel>, from the <embeddedLabel>Available message types</embeddedLabel> box, select the schema for the request message and then select the right arrow icon [ <mediaLinkInline><image xlink:href="a08ed386-6bf6-4164-9052-5f05154d8eff" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"></image></mediaLinkInline> ], and then select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: In <embeddedLabel>Message Type Picker</embeddedLabel>, from the <embeddedLabel>Available message types</embeddedLabel> box, select the schema for the request message and then select the right arrow icon [ <mediaLinkInline><image xlink:href="a08ed386-6bf6-4164-9052-5f05154d8eff" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"></image></mediaLinkInline> ], and then select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, select the Send schema (<codeInline>http://Microsoft.LobServices.Sap/2007/03/Idoc/3/ORDERS05//700/Send</codeInline>).
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, select the Send schema (<codeInline>http://Microsoft.LobServices.Sap/2007/03/Idoc/3/ORDERS05//700/Send</codeInline>).

trans-unit.source: The selected schema is listed under the <embeddedLabel>Request Message Type</embeddedLabel> box.
trans-unit.target: The selected schema is listed under the <embeddedLabel>Request Message Type</embeddedLabel> box.

trans-unit.source: Save the <token>bridge</token> configuration.
trans-unit.target: Save the <token>bridge</token> configuration.

trans-unit.source: To connect the bridge to the relay endpoint
trans-unit.target: To connect the bridge to the relay endpoint

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>SAPIntegration</embeddedLabel> project, from the <embeddedLabel>Toolbox</embeddedLabel>, select the <embeddedLabel>Connection</embeddedLabel> component, and connect the <token>one-way</token> component with the SAP relay endpoint you already added in <link xlink:href="c18c624c-978c-4476-8f03-5caa7b12e103" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Expose a Relay Endpoint to Invoke Operations on ORDERS05 IDOC</link>.
trans-unit.target: In the <embeddedLabel>SAPIntegration</embeddedLabel> project, from the <embeddedLabel>Toolbox</embeddedLabel>, select the <embeddedLabel>Connection</embeddedLabel> component, and connect the <token>one-way</token> component with the SAP relay endpoint you already added in <link xlink:href="c18c624c-978c-4476-8f03-5caa7b12e103" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Expose a Relay Endpoint to Invoke Operations on ORDERS05 IDOC</link>.

trans-unit.source: Set the filter condition on the connection.
trans-unit.target: Set the filter condition on the connection.

trans-unit.source: The routing condition for this scenario is to route all messages to the <token>lobtarget</token>.
trans-unit.target: The routing condition for this scenario is to route all messages to the <token>lobtarget</token>.

trans-unit.source: To do so, select the connecting line, and from the <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel> grid, select the ellipsis <embeddedLabel>(…)</embeddedLabel> in the <embeddedLabel>Filter Condition</embeddedLabel> property, and then select <embeddedLabel>Match All</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: To do so, select the connecting line, and from the <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel> grid, select the ellipsis <embeddedLabel>(…)</embeddedLabel> in the <embeddedLabel>Filter Condition</embeddedLabel> property, and then select <embeddedLabel>Match All</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: This ensures that all messages that come to the bridge are routed to the relay endpoint.
trans-unit.target: This ensures that all messages that come to the bridge are routed to the relay endpoint.

trans-unit.source: Set the <embeddedLabel>Route Action</embeddedLabel> property on the connection.
trans-unit.target: Set the <embeddedLabel>Route Action</embeddedLabel> property on the connection.

trans-unit.source: Before you set the route action, we must understand why it is required.
trans-unit.target: Before you set the route action, we must understand why it is required.

trans-unit.source: The message sent from the EDI receive <token>bridge</token> to the relay endpoint must have the <embeddedLabel>Action</embeddedLabel> SOAP header set on it.
trans-unit.target: The message sent from the EDI receive <token>bridge</token> to the relay endpoint must have the <embeddedLabel>Action</embeddedLabel> SOAP header set on it.

trans-unit.source: This header defines what operation must be performed on the SAP system.
trans-unit.target: This header defines what operation must be performed on the SAP system.

trans-unit.source: The message that comes from the EDI receive pipeline does not have this header set.
trans-unit.target: The message that comes from the EDI receive pipeline does not have this header set.

trans-unit.source: Hence, in this intermediary <token>xml_bridge</token>, you set the route action on the message before it is sent the relay endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Hence, in this intermediary <token>xml_bridge</token>, you set the route action on the message before it is sent the relay endpoint.

trans-unit.source: As part of the route action, you add the required header on the message.
trans-unit.target: As part of the route action, you add the required header on the message.

trans-unit.source: Perform the following steps to set the route action.
trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps to set the route action.

trans-unit.source: Find out the value that will be set for the <embeddedLabel>Action</embeddedLabel> SOAP header message.
trans-unit.target: Find out the value that will be set for the <embeddedLabel>Action</embeddedLabel> SOAP header message.

trans-unit.source: To do so, right-click the SAP relay endpoint from the Server explorer, and from the <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel> grid, expand <embeddedLabel>Operations</embeddedLabel>, and copy the value.
trans-unit.target: To do so, right-click the SAP relay endpoint from the Server explorer, and from the <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel> grid, expand <embeddedLabel>Operations</embeddedLabel>, and copy the value.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, the value is <codeInline>http://Microsoft.LobServices.Sap/2007/03/Idoc/3/ORDERS05//700/Send</codeInline>:
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, the value is <codeInline>http://Microsoft.LobServices.Sap/2007/03/Idoc/3/ORDERS05//700/Send</codeInline>:

trans-unit.source: Go back to the <token>bridge</token> design area, select the connection between the <token>bridge</token> and the SAP relay, and from the <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel> grid, select the ellipsis <embeddedLabel>(…)</embeddedLabel> in the <embeddedLabel>Route Action</embeddedLabel> property.
trans-unit.target: Go back to the <token>bridge</token> design area, select the connection between the <token>bridge</token> and the SAP relay, and from the <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel> grid, select the ellipsis <embeddedLabel>(…)</embeddedLabel> in the <embeddedLabel>Route Action</embeddedLabel> property.

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>Route Actions</embeddedLabel> dialog box, select <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel> to open the <embeddedLabel>Add Route Action</embeddedLabel> dialog box.
trans-unit.target: In the <embeddedLabel>Route Actions</embeddedLabel> dialog box, select <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel> to open the <embeddedLabel>Add Route Action</embeddedLabel> dialog box.

trans-unit.source: In <embeddedLabel>Add Route Action</embeddedLabel>:
trans-unit.target: In <embeddedLabel>Add Route Action</embeddedLabel>:

trans-unit.source: Under <embeddedLabel>Property (Read From)</embeddedLabel> section, select <embeddedLabel>Expression</embeddedLabel> and specify the value that you copied earlier.
trans-unit.target: Under <embeddedLabel>Property (Read From)</embeddedLabel> section, select <embeddedLabel>Expression</embeddedLabel> and specify the value that you copied earlier.

trans-unit.source: Make sure you specify the value for <embeddedLabel>Expression</embeddedLabel> within single quotes.
trans-unit.target: Make sure you specify the value for <embeddedLabel>Expression</embeddedLabel> within single quotes.

trans-unit.source: Under <embeddedLabel>Destination (Write-To)</embeddedLabel> section, set the <embeddedLabel>Type</embeddedLabel> to <embeddedLabel>SOAP</embeddedLabel> and the <embeddedLabel>Identifier</embeddedLabel> to <embeddedLabel>Action</embeddedLabel>:
trans-unit.target: Under <embeddedLabel>Destination (Write-To)</embeddedLabel> section, set the <embeddedLabel>Type</embeddedLabel> to <embeddedLabel>SOAP</embeddedLabel> and the <embeddedLabel>Identifier</embeddedLabel> to <embeddedLabel>Action</embeddedLabel>:

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel> in the <embeddedLabel>Add Route Action</embeddedLabel> dialog box to add the route action.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel> in the <embeddedLabel>Add Route Action</embeddedLabel> dialog box to add the route action.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel> in the <embeddedLabel>Route Actions</embeddedLabel> dialog box and then select <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel> to save changes to an Enterprise Application Integration project.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel> in the <embeddedLabel>Route Actions</embeddedLabel> dialog box and then select <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel> to save changes to an Enterprise Application Integration project.

trans-unit.source: Save the project.
trans-unit.target: Save the project.

trans-unit.source: The final bridge configuration resembles the following:
trans-unit.target: The final bridge configuration resembles the following:

trans-unit.source: To deploy the solution
trans-unit.target: To deploy the solution

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, right click the <embeddedLabel>SAPIntegration</embeddedLabel> solution, and then select <embeddedLabel>Build Solution</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, right click the <embeddedLabel>SAPIntegration</embeddedLabel> solution, and then select <embeddedLabel>Build Solution</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Once the build succeeds, right click the <embeddedLabel>SAPIntegration</embeddedLabel> solution, and then click <embeddedLabel>Deploy Solution</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Once the build succeeds, right click the <embeddedLabel>SAPIntegration</embeddedLabel> solution, and then click <embeddedLabel>Deploy Solution</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In the deployment window, the <embeddedLabel>Deployment Endpoint</embeddedLabel> is a read-only property and the value is derived from the <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service URL/Namespace</embeddedLabel> set in the message flow surface.
trans-unit.target: In the deployment window, the <embeddedLabel>Deployment Endpoint</embeddedLabel> is a read-only property and the value is derived from the <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service URL/Namespace</embeddedLabel> set in the message flow surface.

trans-unit.source: However, you must provide the ACS Namespace for BizTalk Services, Issuer Name, and Shared Secret.
trans-unit.target: However, you must provide the ACS Namespace for BizTalk Services, Issuer Name, and Shared Secret.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>Deploy</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>Deploy</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: The Visual Studio Output pane displays the deployment progress and result.
trans-unit.target: The Visual Studio Output pane displays the deployment progress and result.

trans-unit.source: The URL where the bridge is deployed is also displayed in the Output pane.
trans-unit.target: The URL where the bridge is deployed is also displayed in the Output pane.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, the bridge is deployed at <codeInline>http://<legacyItalic>%%amp;lt;mybiztalkservicename%%amp;gt;</legacyItalic>.biztalk.windows.net/default/<codeFeaturedElement>B2BConnector</codeFeaturedElement></codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, the bridge is deployed at <codeInline>http://<legacyItalic>%%amp;lt;mybiztalkservicename%%amp;gt;</legacyItalic>.biztalk.windows.net/default/<codeFeaturedElement>B2BConnector</codeFeaturedElement></codeInline>.
